verses.text: Now there were seventy sons of Ahab in Samaria. Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria, to the rulers of Jezreel, to the elders, and to those who raised Ahab’s children, saying,
verses.comment: Faithful to the original; 'those who raised' refers to guardians or caretakers.

verses.text: "Now, as soon as this letter reaches you—since your master’s sons are with you, and you have chariots and horses, a fortified city and weapons—
verses.comment: Chariots and horses imply military capability.

verses.text: "choose the best and most capable of your master’s sons, set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house."
verses.comment: Literal rendering of 'best and most capable'.

verses.text: But they were terrified and said, "Look, two kings could not stand before him; how can we stand?"
verses.comment: Maintains the question and reason for their fear.

verses.text: So the person who was in charge of the palace, the person in charge of the city, the elders, and the guardians sent word to Jehu, saying, "We are your servants, and we will do anything you ask of us. We will not appoint anyone as king; do whatever you think is right."
verses.comment: "Person in charge" is the literal translation of 'he who was over the house.'

verses.text: Then he wrote them a second letter, saying, "If you are on my side and will obey me, bring the heads of your master’s sons to me at Jezreel by tomorrow at this time." Now the seventy sons of the king were with the prominent men of the city who were raising them.
verses.comment: Implication: they were responsible for their upbringing and location.

verses.text: So when the letter reached them, they took the king’s sons and killed seventy men, putting their heads in baskets and sending them to Jehu at Jezreel.
verses.comment: Clarity added: heads placed in baskets.

verses.text: A messenger came and told Jehu, "They have brought the heads of the king’s sons." Jehu said, "Put them in two piles at the entrance of the gate until morning."
verses.comment: Literal meaning kept: two piles at the gate.

verses.text: In the morning, he went out and stood and said to all the people, "You are innocent. I conspired against my master and killed him, but who struck all these?"
verses.comment: "You are innocent" is a direct rendering from 'You are just' or 'righteous.'

verses.text: "Know then that nothing of the word of the LORD, which the LORD spoke about the house of Ahab, will fail; for the LORD has done what He said through His servant Elijah."
verses.comment: Maintains literal phrasing and reference to God's word.

verses.text: So Jehu killed all who remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, all his officials, close friends, and priests, until he left none remaining.
verses.comment: Clarifies that all were killed, none left.

verses.text: Then he set out and came to Samaria. On the way, at Beth Eked of the shepherds,
verses.comment: Beth Eked is kept as a place name.

verses.text: Jehu met the relatives of Ahaziah, king of Judah, and asked, "Who are you?" They answered, "We are relatives of Ahaziah, and we have come down to greet the sons of the king and the sons of the queen mother."
verses.comment: "Greet" renders the original verb meaning 'salute' or 'visit.'

verses.text: Jehu said, "Take them alive!" So they took them alive and slaughtered them at the well of Beth Eked—forty-two men. He left none of them alive.
verses.comment: Explicit statement of none left alive.

verses.text: When he left there, he met Jehonadab son of Rechab, coming to meet him. He greeted him and said, "Is your heart right, as my heart is with yours?" Jehonadab answered, "It is." Jehu said, "If it is, give me your hand." So he gave him his hand, and Jehu helped him up into the chariot.
verses.comment: Maintained the literal greeting and hand-taking.

verses.text: And he said, "Come with me and see my zeal for the LORD." So he had him ride in his chariot.
verses.comment: Maintained "zeal for the LORD".

verses.text: When Jehu came to Samaria, he struck down all who remained to Ahab in Samaria, until he had destroyed them, according to the word of the LORD spoken to Elijah.
verses.comment: Direct connection to Elijah's prophecy.

verses.text: Then Jehu gathered all the people together and said to them, "Ahab served Baal a little, but Jehu will serve him much.
verses.comment: 'Serve him much' is rendered from the original sarcasm.

verses.text: Now therefore, call to me all the prophets of Baal, all his worshipers, and all his priests. Let no one be missing, for I have a great sacrifice for Baal. Whoever is missing shall not live." But Jehu was acting with deception so that he could destroy the worshipers of Baal.
verses.comment: Explicit statement added about Jehu's deception.

verses.text: Jehu said, "Proclaim a solemn assembly for Baal." So they proclaimed it.
verses.comment: Maintains the original command.

verses.text: Jehu sent throughout all Israel, and all the worshipers of Baal came, so there was not a man left who did not come. They entered the house of Baal, and the house of Baal was filled from one end to the other.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of 'from one end to the other.'

verses.text: He said to the person in charge of the wardrobe, "Bring out garments for all the worshipers of Baal." So he brought out garments for them.
verses.comment: Wardrobe manager is kept literal.

verses.text: Then Jehu and Jehonadab son of Rechab went into the house of Baal and said to the worshipers of Baal, "Look carefully and make sure there are no servants of the LORD here with you, but only the worshipers of Baal."
verses.comment: Maintains the original emphasis on exclusivity.

verses.text: So they entered to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings. Now Jehu had appointed eighty men outside, and said, "If any of the men I deliver into your hands escapes, whoever lets him go, it will be his life for the life of the one who escapes."
verses.comment: Life for life language kept literal.

verses.text: As soon as he had finished offering the burnt offering, Jehu said to the guards and the officers, "Go in and kill them; let no one escape." So they struck them with the edge of the sword, and the guards and the officers threw the bodies out and went into the inner rooms of the house of Baal.
verses.comment: Clarifies sequence: offering finished then massacre.

verses.text: They brought out the pillars from the house of Baal and burned them.
verses.comment: Pillars likely refers to cultic objects.

verses.text: They broke down the pillar of Baal and tore down the house of Baal, making it a latrine to this day.
verses.comment: "Latrine" is direct translation from 'outhouse.'

verses.text: So Jehu destroyed Baal worship in Israel.
verses.comment: Summary statement, matches original.

verses.text: However, Jehu did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin—the golden calves that were in Bethel and Dan.
verses.comment: Clear mention of golden calves maintained.

verses.text: The LORD said to Jehu, "Because you have done well in carrying out what is right in My eyes and have done to the house of Ahab all that was in My heart, your sons of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel."
verses.comment: Kept promise of four generations as original.

verses.text: But Jehu was not careful to walk in the law of the LORD, the God of Israel, with all his heart; he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, which made Israel sin.
verses.comment: Phrase 'walk in the law of the LORD' matches the original concept.

verses.text: In those days the LORD began to cut off parts of Israel, and Hazael struck them in all the territory of Israel
verses.comment: Faithfully renders the judgment of losing territory.

verses.text: from the Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead—the Gadites, the Reubenites, and the Manassites—from Aroer by the Arnon River, Gilead, and Bashan.
verses.comment: Tribal territories and locations kept literal.

verses.text: The rest of the acts of Jehu, all that he did, and all his might, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
verses.comment: Standard biblical summary formula.

verses.text: And Jehu slept with his fathers, and they buried him in Samaria. Jehoahaz his son became king in his place.
verses.comment: "Slept with his fathers" kept as idiom for death.

verses.text: The period that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty-eight years.
verses.comment: Reign duration as specified in original.
